text: Charles-Édouard Frère (July 10, 1837 – November 3, 1894) was a French genre painter. Helping Hands, 1880 Frère was born in Paris as the son of Pierre Édouard Frère, whose style of genre works he continued. He is known for interiors and landscapes. The orientalist Charles-Théodore Frère was his uncle.Charles Edouard Frère in the RKD Charles-Édouard Frère died in Mareil- en-France, after a falling from a cart. Le Gaulois, November 4, 1894. ==References== * *Charles Edouard Frère on artnet Category:1837 births Category:1894 deaths Category:People from Paris Category:19th-century French painters Category:French male painters Category:19th-century male artists
title: Charles Edouard Frère
